medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with crampy abdominal pain radiating to the epigastric region, which was prolonged and severe, having occurred off and on during her pregnancy. The most intense episode lasted for 6 hours prior to admission, accompanied by new nausea and vomiting. She also reports intermittent heartburn, chills, and decreased appetite.
medical_history.past_medical_history: S/P appendectomy and tonsillectomy; ovarian cyst.
medical_history.family_history: Gallbladder issues and stones in her uncle and cousins.
medical_history.social_history: Reported drinking 3 coronas two days ago.
